titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: . The Financial Debate ended in a considerable triumph for those who are opposed to centralisation. The Civilian Candidate Test School at Knutsford was rejected by an overwhelming vote in spite of frenzied protests from Birchall & Hicks.
Sir Henry Craik wrote a violent note protesting against my vote yesterday: I returned a peaceful answer!

Then I had tea with mine hostess & came away by the 5.30 p.m. train from King's Cross. I was met at Darlington by Clayton & William. Much snow still lay on the ground. I relieved the tedium of the journey by reading through the translation of Ferrero's "The Ruin of Ancient Civilization & the Triumph of Christianity" â€“ a melancholy & suggestive book.
